title: 'RHONJ': The 3 questions Teresa and Joe Giudice need to answer on 'Unlocked' with Andy Cohen
text:
CLOSE Joe Giudice is primarily known for being married to Teresa Giudice of Bravo’s “The Real Housewives of New Jersey.” He's now making headlines for his legal troubles. USA TODAY

Say it ain't so, Joe.

Or, say it is so, Joe.

Joe Giudice and Teresa Giudice of Bravo's "The Real Housewives of New Jersey" sit down Sunday night with "RHONJ" show producer Andy Cohen at 8 p.m. ET for “Joe and Teresa: Unlocked.”

Joe Giudice was a star of "RHONJ," but he hasn't been on the show for more than four years as he's been in federal prison, for tax fraud, and in ICE custody, as an immigration court ruled Giudice was to be deported back to Italy upon the completion of his federal sentence.

Joe went to Italy, the country of his birth, on Oct. 11 as he continues to appeal his deportation. That's where he talks to Cohen and Teresa from. He's wearing an orange jacket in teasers released by Bravo.

We have a few questions for Teresa and Joe that we hope will be answered on "Unlocked":

Teresa, will you and the girls move to Italy if Joe is deported?

Teresa has stated in the past that she, and their four children, will not relocate to Italy if Joe is deported.

“It’s like starting a whole new life, and (my kids) have been through so much already,” said Teresa on a “RHONJ” reunion which aired March 6. “So, I mean, I’m not doing a long-distance relationship. I’m just not doing it. You know, I want somebody with me every day. And I know exactly what happens, like, I’m sure he’ll be with other women. It happens. So, if we do the long-distance thing, it’s not going to work. I’d be like, bye-bye.”

So, Teresa, is it still "bye-bye?"

Joe Giudice released from ICE custody, headed to Italy

Teresa, do you blame Joe for your going to prison?

Teresa served 11 months in federal prison for a related tax fraud charge. She hinted that Joe was to blame for her sentence, and she was angry that her being behind bars took her away during her mother's final days on the Feb. 27 "Reunion" show.

“Of course I’m angry with him. I went to jail. I went to jail. Of course I’m angry!” Teresa said. “I have a small family, I only have my brother, my mother, my father, and my four daughters. That’s it. That’s my family. So I’m angry that I came home, eight months later, I lost my mom. I do throw it in his face when I get mad. I’m like, ‘You shouldn’t have screwed up.’ "

This anger may be part of the reason they don't seem to be a happy family now.

Teresa, were you faithful to Joe while he was in prison?

Teresa was photographed hand-in-hand with Totowa realtor Blake Schreck, who is 20 years her junior, in February, and her camp has denied that there's anything going on since. The infidelity question is a plotline for Season 10 of "RHONJ" Season 10, according to the trailer.

In the teaser for “Unlocked,” infidelity is discussed on the edges.

"Do I feel like he was faithful?” Teresa says, replying to herself, “no.”

“You were photographed with women, also," says Teresa to Joe.

“That’s why I made it OK for you,” says Joe to Teresa, implying that he thinks she cheated.

“I have a lot of guy friends,” says Teresa.

“That you hold hands with?” Cohen quips.

Cohen wraps it up by saying: "This relationship, it kind of seems like you're speaking about it in the past tense."

description: "Real Housewives of New Jersey" stars Teresa and Joe Giudice sit down Sunday night with show producer Andy Cohen to talk Joe's deportation appeal.
